definition: demand for something as rightful or due, to take, as an undesirable consequence of some event or state of affairs
details:
noun
- demand for something as rightful or due
= example: demand for something as rightful or due
- an informal right to something
= example: an informal right to something
= synonyms: title
- an established or recognized right
= example: an established or recognized right
= synonyms: title
- an assertion of a right, for example money or property
= example: an assertion of a right, for example money or property
- an assertion that something is true or factual
= example: an assertion that something is true or factual
- a demand especially in the phrase 'the call of duty'
= synonyms: call
verb
- to take, as an undesirable consequence of some event or state of affairs
= example: to take, as an undesirable consequence of some event or state of affairs
= synonyms: take
- to assert or affirm strongly
- to lay claim to
= synonyms: take
- to ask for legally or make a legal claim to, as of debts, for example
= example: to ask for legally or make a legal claim to, as of debts, for example
- to demand as being one's due or property
= synonyms: arrogate, lay claim
